metadata.title: CVE-2017-17480 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in thepgxtovolume function in jp3d/convert.c. The vulnerability causes anout-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possiblyremote code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1').
